info.title: ORB Intelligence
info.description: Orb provides with a framework of API calls to use the Orb database for various use cases. The framework comprises five calls, Match, Fetch, Search, Lookalike and Corporate Tree.

parameters.name: address1
parameters.description: First line of the company's address.
parameters.x-ms-summary: First line of the company's address.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Any email based on a company's domain.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Any email based on a company's domain.

parameters.name: ein
parameters.x-ms-summary: U.S. Federal Enployeer Tax ID (EIN) of the company, for example, "204971292".

parameters.name: npi
parameters.description: National Provider Identifier, a unique 10-digit identification number issued to health care providers in the United States.

parameters.name: lei
parameters.description: Legal Entity Identifier, 20-character, alpha-numeric code based on the ISO 17442.

parameters.name: orb_num
parameters.description: Orb Number to match input data with particular company
parameters.x-ms-summary: Orb Number to match input data with particular company

orb_num.description: Orb Number of the candidate profile.
orb_num.x-ms-summary: Orb Number of the candidate profile.

orb_nums.description: Secondary Orb Numbers of the candidate profile. Hidden by default, use `include` option to show.
orb_nums.x-ms-summary: Secondary Orb Numbers of the candidate profile. Hidden by default, use `include` option to show.

parent_orb_num.description: Orb Number of a parent company, if this company is a subsidiary

ultimate_parent_orb_num.description: Orb Number of the ultimate parent company.

ultimate_parent_name.description: Name of the ultimate parent company.

is_standalone_company.description: Company is considered as standalone if it does not have parent and subsidiaries.

address1.description: First line of the company's address.

fetch_url.description: 'Fetch' API call to retrieve the full company profile for this Orb Number.

parent_orb_num.description: Orb Number of a parent company, if this company is a subsidiary

ultimate_parent_orb_num.description: Orb Number of the ultimate parent company.

ultimate_parent_name.description: Name of the ultimate parent company.

names.description: Company's other names - tradestyles, DBA names, former names, abbreviations

orb_web_rank.description: is a normalized Alexa rank. The normalization handles two cases: 1. Alexa service does not have this web domain in their database, so there is no Alexa rank for this web domain, then we set it to the maximum - 39999999; 2. For third and higher -level domains, like for example, dolls.stores.shop.ebay.com Alexa service returns alexa rank for ebay.com, which is not good in our use case, as it is a small online shop, not Ebay website. We set this to 39999999.

domain_is_email_hosting.description: 1 if this domain is a popular email service provider, such as, for example, gmail.com, yahoo.com, outlook.com and others. 1 - the domain is an email service provider; 0 - we are not aware of any popular email service provider with this domain. This flag is useful when the domain you want to get company information for was extracted from a person's contact email. So, for example, when it is 'yahoo.com', it does not mean that the person works at Yahoo!

webdomains_info.description: All company's web domains with additional info: domain_has_email; domain_has_website; domain_is_email_hosting - such as gmail.com, hotmail.com; orb_web_rank - normalized Alexa rank

naics_code.description: Primary NAICS code according to 2012 Census.gov standard

example.description: Computer Systems Design and Related Services

sic_code.description: Primary SIC code according to 1987 standard

example.description: Computer Programming, Data Processing, And Other Computerrelated

categories.description: Array of Orb proprietary business categories with weights

description.example: Company information database for B2B marketing and sales.

linkedin_account.description: URL to the company's LinkedIn page

facebook_account.description: URL to the company's Facebook page

twitter_account.description: URL to the company's Twitter account

googleplus_account.description: URL to the company's Google plus page

youtube_account.description: URL to the company's Youtube page

technologies.description: List of frontend technologies installed on the company's website

rankings.description: Popular list the company may be included, such as Fortune, Forbes, Inc.com

ranking_positions.description: Popular list the company may be included, such as Fortune, Forbes, Inc.com (with positions)

npis.description: National Provider Identifier (NPI), a unique 10-digit identification number issued to health care providers in the United States.

total_funding.description: Total funding amount raised by the company

phone.description: General phone number of the company

importance_score.description: Importance score: A, B or C. See documentation for more details

tickers.description: Stock exchange tickers if the company is publicly listed.Use GET /3/dictionaries/stock_exchanges to get a list of all stock exchanges.

main_name.description: match | similar: x% | relaxed match | no match | missing input | no data

other_names.description: match | similar: x% | relaxed match | no match | missing input | no data

webdomain.description: match | no match | redirect match | email match | missing input | no data

address1.description: match | no match | missing input | no data

city.description: match | no match | missing input | no data

state.description: match | no match | missing input | no data

zip.description: match | no match | missing input | no data

country.description: match | no match | missing input | no data

phone.description: match | no match | missing input | no data

ein.description: match | no match | missing input | no data

npi.description: match | no match | missing input | no data

lei.description: match | no match | missing input | no data

matched_fields.description: Orb company fields which matched input data.

get.summary: The Match API call performs a candidate retrieval process
get.description: The Match API call performs a candidate retrieval process; the process by which Orb records are identified as potential matches to the query. The input fields must either include the name and country, or the website/email, or the EIN of the company record. All other fields are optional. Users can review the candidates to choose their preferred match based on the candidate with the highest Confidence Score, algorithmically, based on the match mask (for example, take those that match by website, even though the name didn't match) or manually.

get.summary: Obtain a full company profile from the Orb database
get.description: The Fetch API call allows a user to obtain a full company profile from the Orb database, based on an Orb Number. The Orb Number for a company record can be obtained from a choosing a candidate from the Match call or from a previously identified matched record. The Fetch API call will return back all the standard fields in the Orb database for a single company record that corresponds to the Orb Number.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results in response (in a page).
parameters.x-ms-summary: Number of results in response (in a page).

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of results to skip (to get a particular page).
parameters.x-ms-summary: Number of results to skip (to get a particular page).

parameters.name: industry
parameters.description: Company's industry. Use GET /dictionaries/industries to get a list of all industry names

parameters.name: techs
parameters.description: Filter by techonologies installed. Use GET /dictionaries/technologies to get a list of all technologies names that we track

parameters.name: tech_categories
parameters.description: Filter by techonologies classes. Use GET /dictionaries/technologies/categories to get a list of all technologies classes

parameters.name: rankings
parameters.description: Get companies from companies ranked lists, such as Forbes, Fortune or Inc.5000. Get the full list of rankings using GET /dictionaries/rankings
parameters.x-ms-summary: Get companies from companies ranked lists

parameters.name: importance_score
parameters.description: Filter companies by importances classes A, B or C. See description of our importance classes in internal documentation
parameters.x-ms-summary: Filter companies by importances classes A, B or C

parameters.name: cik
parameters.description: Filter by CIK (The Central Index Key from SEC).
parameters.x-ms-summary: Filter by CIK (The Central Index Key from SEC).

parameters.name: exchange
parameters.description: Filter by stock exchange. Use GET /3/dictionaries/stock_exchanges to get a list of all stock exchanges.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Extra output fields to include in response, for example optional `orb_nums` field.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Extra output fields to include in response

get.summary: Retrieves a list of companies for the given search criteria
get.description: The Search API call allows a user to retrieve a list of companies for the given search criteria. This enables a user to build out a list of companies for use cases such as building out a list of companies in a specific territory or segment. The input to the Search call are a list of filtering attributes that define the companies in the list. These filters can include the geographic location of the companies (at a city, state or country level), revenue, number of employees and their industry profile (e.g., SIC, NAICS, or Orb's proprietary categories classification).

get.summary: Retrieves a list of companies similar to a target company
get.description: The Lookalike API call allows a user to retrieve a list of companies similar to a target company. The input to the Lookalike call are the Orb Number of the target company.

get.summary: Retrieves full corporate tree of subsidiaries
get.description: The Corporate Tree API call allows a user to retrieve full corporate tree of subsidiaries for a given company, starting from its ultimate parent company. The input to the Corporate Tree call is the Orb Number of the target company (mandatory field).

ORB provides dictionaries for various type of fields:

- [industries](http://api.orb-intelligence.com/3/dictionaries/industries?api_key=c66c5dad-395c-4ec6-afdf-7b78eb94166a) - Returns a list of all industries.

- [naics_codes](http://api.orb-intelligence.com/3/dictionaries/naics_codes?api_key=c66c5dad-395c-4ec6-afdf-7b78eb94166a) - Returns a list of all NAICS codes and their descriptions. The codes are based on the NAICS standard, which is the latest version of the standard. For more information on NAICS 2012 and mappings to the previous versions see US Census NAICS page (mappings).

- [sic_codes](http://api.orb-intelligence.com/3/dictionaries/sic_codes?api_key=c66c5dad-395c-4ec6-afdf-7b78eb94166a) - Returns a list of all SIC codes and their descriptions.

- [rankings](http://api.orb-intelligence.com/3/dictionaries/rankings?api_key=c66c5dad-395c-4ec6-afdf-7b78eb94166a) - Returns a list of all company rankings.

- [technologies](http://api.orb-intelligence.com/3/dictionaries/technologies?api_key=c66c5dad-395c-4ec6-afdf-7b78eb94166a) - Returns a list of all technologies.

- [technologies/categories](http://api.orb-intelligence.com/3/dictionaries/technologies/categories?api_key=c66c5dad-395c-4ec6-afdf-7b78eb94166a) - Returns a list of all technology categories and related technologies.

- [categories](http://api.orb-intelligence.com/3/dictionaries/categories?api_key=c66c5dad-395c-4ec6-afdf-7b78eb94166a) - Returns a list of all categories.

- [stock_exchanges](http://api.orb-intelligence.com/3/dictionaries/stock_exchanges?api_key=c66c5dad-395c-4ec6-afdf-7b78eb94166a) - Returns a list of all stock exchanges.
